title: Need help with script
content:
I'm trying to identify this typeface. Any help appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [script sample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140831012755/http:/typophile.com/files/script%20sample.jpg) | 148.47 KB |
author: bjennings

comments.content:
Spent some time on this but drew a blank.  
It's somewhat of an oddball. Seems to be a very plain script doctored with flourishes. I also had no success in finding a similar plain script. Any suggestions as to a plain script?  
Don

Don, thanks for having a go at this. It pretty much has everyone stumped at this point. I haven't come close identifying even the plain script.

Bill

Bill, about all I have left as a suggestion, is that the S and s are the most distinctive earmarks. Narrow it down to plain scripts with something similar and that at least would be something.  
Don
